title: Meta freezes AI hiring after $14B spending spree and costly talent poaching: Is the AI bubble bursting?
description: Meta has slammed the brakes on hiring for its artificial intelligence division, a sudden pause that follows one of the most expensive talent grabs Silicon Valley has seen in years. title: AI may not be the job killer many feared: Signs of a balanced future with automation
description: Despite widespread fears that artificial intelligence would trigger mass layoffs, new research and labor data show a slower, more selective impact. While sectors like customer support face disruption, studies suggest most industries are seeing gradual changes in tasks and skills rather than widespread job losses. Experts say the challenge ahead lies in adapting to new workplace demands, not preparing for a collapse in employment.
content:
Early Fears of Job Losses
More Nuanced Outlook from Industry Leaders

title: Indian team bags third spot in its debut appearance at AI Olympiad
description: Indian high school students win medals at International Olympiad in Artificial Intelligence, beating US and China, showcasing academic excellence.
content:
In its first time participating at the International Olympiad in Artificial Intelligence (IOAI), two teams of eight students from India came third out of 63 participating countries beating teams from US and China.

title: Tech war: DeepSeek hints China close to unveiling home-grown ‘next generation’ AI chips
description: The artificial intelligence company mentions ‘home-grown chips to be released soon’ on social media, but provides no further details.
content:
Chinese artificial intelligence start-up DeepSeek said that China will soon have home-grown “next generation” chips for AI stacking, fanning speculation over breakthroughs China may have achieved.

title: Microsoft's Mustafa Suleyman Warns Of 'Seemingly Conscious AI', Experts Urge Guardrails
description: Artificial intelligence may soon feel alive, but that doesn’t mean it will be. Mustafa Suleyman, chief executive officer of Microsoft AI, has warned that the world is on the brink of what he calls "Seemingly Conscious AI", which he defines as systems so advanced they mimic memory, empathy and personality, leading people to believe they are interacting with sentient beings.
content:
Artificial intelligence may soon feel alive, but that doesn’t mean it will be.

title: Self-driving vehicle startup Nuro valued at $6 billion in late-stage funding round
description: The latest tranche of $97 million follows the $106 million announced in April, which included investors such as T. Rowe Price, Fidelity, and Tiger Global. Many startups that became unicorns during the 2021 funding boom are now raising capital at lower valuations as investors' attention turns toward artificial intelligence. Nuro has been pushing to scale its self-driving platform and expand commercial partnerships.
content:
(Reuters) -Self-driving vehicle startup Nuro closed its late-stage funding round on Thursday, raising $203 million at a $6 billion valuation from new investors Uber and Nvidia alongside returning backers.

title: ATP flags more than 162,000 abusive comments in first year of protection service
description: BENGALURU - Top men's tennis players were shielded from more than 162,000 social media comments containing \"severe\" abuse during the first year of the Artificial Intelligence-powered ATP Safe Sport initiative, the sport's governing body said on Thursday. title: Meta freezes AI hiring after blockbuster spending spree
description: A hiring freeze at Meta Platforms’ artificial-intelligence operations is in effect after investors voiced concerns about the scale of Meta’s stock-based compensation costs.
content:
